text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs to reach his apartment on the 10th floor.
However, on rainy days and when other people are in the elevator, he goes directly to the 10th floor in the elevator.

Why does he normally get off on the 7th floor? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I need to figure out why the man gets off the elevator on the 7th floor every morning.
Let me break this down step by step.
First, the man lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor.
That makes sense because it's faster than walking down 10 flights of stairs.
Now, in the evening, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs to his apartment on the 10th floor.
Hmm, why doesn't he just take the elevator all the way to the 10th floor in the evening? Maybe there's a reason related to the elevator's behavior or building rules.
On rainy days and when other people are in the elevator, he goes directly to the 10th floor.
So, normally, he doesn't do that.
So, there must be something about the elevator's operation that changes based on certain conditions.
Wait, maybe the elevator has a rule about not going all the way to the top floor unless certain conditions are met.
Perhaps when it's raining, the elevator is more likely to stop at higher floors, or maybe the man prefers it that way.
Also, when other people are in the elevator, maybe the elevator behaves differently, perhaps stopping at specific floors more frequently.
Another angle: maybe the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor in the evening unless it's raining or there are people inside.
So, on normal days without rain or people, it stops at the 7th floor, and he gets off there.
Then he walks up the stairs from the 7th to the 10th.
But when it's rainy or crowded, the elevator goes all the way to the 10th floor.
So, the key point is that the elevator's behavior changes based on the conditions.
Normally, it stops at the 7th floor, but on rainy days or when others are in the elevator, it goes higher.
But wait, why specifically the 7th floor? Maybe the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor during non-rainy days, and when it's rainy or crowded, it goes higher.
So, normally, he gets off at the 7th floor because that's where the elevator stops when it's not raining or crowded.
Alternatively, maybe the man prefers to get off at the 7th floor because the elevator doesn't go higher unless certain conditions are met.
So, normally, the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor, but on rainy days or when others are present, it goes all the way to the 10th.
I think the main reason is that the elevator's operation is such that it stops at the 7th floor on normal days, and only goes higher on rainy or crowded days.

So, he gets off at the 7th floor because that's where the elevator normally stops, and then he walks up the stairs because the elevator doesn't go all the way to the 10th floor unless it's raining or there are people inside.
So, putting it all together, the man gets off on the 7th floor because the elevator doesn't go higher unless it's raining or there are other people in it.
Normally, the elevator stops at the 7th floor, and he walks the rest of the way up.
On rainy days or when the elevator is busy, it takes him all the way to the 10th floor.

</think>

The man gets off the elevator on the 7th floor because the elevator typically stops there on normal days.
On rainy days or when the elevator is occupied by others, it goes all the way to the 10th floor.
So, he normally stops at the 7th floor and walks up the stairs because the elevator doesn't go higher unless it's raining or crowded.
